Distortion Class¶

Distortion functions to implement spectral risk measures

class aggregate.spectral.Distortion(name, shape, r0=0.0)[source]¶

handles everything to do with distortion functions

classmethod available_distortions(pricing=True)[source]¶

list of the available distortions

Parameters:pricing – only return list suitable for pricing
Returns:
static distortions_from_params(params, index, r0=0.025, plot=True)[source]¶

make set of dist funs and inverses from params, output of port.calibrate_distortions params must just have one row for each method and be in the output format of cal_dist

Parameters:
  • plot –
  • index –
  • r0 – min rol parameters
  • params – dataframe such that params[index, :] has a [lep, param] etc.
Returns:
plot(xs=None, n=101, both=True, ax=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

quick plot of the distortion

Parameters:
  • ax –
  • xs –
  • n – length of vector is no xs
  • both – ignored for now. just do both
  • kwargs – passed to plot

classmethod test(r0=0.05)[source]¶

tester: make some nice plots

Returns:

aggregate

aggregate is a Python package providing fast, accurate, and expressive datastructures designed to make working with probability distributions easy and intuitive.
